name: CHCH.JS
description:
For those in Christchurch interested in everything JavaScript. Node.js, frameworks, libraries and everything in between. Newbies, battle-hardened veterans, all welcome!

We meet once a month and alternate our monthly sessions between node.js and front-end JavaScript.

Join the group to find out when and where our next meetup is.

Tell us your talk ideas or submit a talk here: http://goo.gl/forms/v8lcHdrGJH

name: TriJS
description: PHP, .NET, Java, Ruby/Rails, Node.JS, Python/Django. No matter what kind of web developer you are, you're using JavaScript. This group is dedicated to the language that brings us all together - the world's most popular language and the world's most horribly used. We'll talk JavaScript, Angular.JS, jQuery, Node.JS and more.

organizer.name: Ryan Hayes
organizer.bio:
Web: https://ryanhayes.net

Everything Else: @RyannosaurusRex

name: Sails.js Austin
description: This has always been a group for developing ideas and apps with Sails.js, the MVC framework for Node.js...now find us over on the Austin Node.js Meetup page~ http://www.meetup.com/noders/

name: Tampa NodeJS
description: The purpose of Tampa NodeJS is to bring together developers that are interested in learning more about Node.js and all things related. This group is open to anyone that's interested, no experience necessary, if you want to learn more about Node or you want to share your knowledge then please join us!

organizer.name: Eli Wheaton
organizer.bio: I'm a freelance web developer that builds websites using Node, Express, MongoDB, JavaScript, PHP, MySQL, Laravel, HTML, CSS, jQuery, CodeIgniter & WordPress.

name: Dallas Blockchain & Hyperledger Meetup
description: Bringing new vibrance to the DFW community. Blockchain today is best expressed through the more popular Bitcoin. However, this group not about Bitcoin, it is about applying the underlying technology platform and protocol to innumerable use cases across sectors and for business models. As a technology, Blockchain is a platform and protocol fabric for distributed database ledger across trustless nodes in a permissioned or permissionless network of peer nodes. As for use cases, they can range from financial services, Internet of things, supply chain, trade finance, property transaction, land rights, i.e., in short, any use case characterized by Trust, Rules, Identity, Payment, and Reputation. Blockchain enables business models which engage exchange of assets, have a need for a truth source, and run smart contracts. Calling all developers, business leaders, learners and doers to new proving grounds.

name: bayAreaJS
description:
This group will focus on workshops, meetups, and discussion on web development topics in general as well as Javascript related technologies. The goal is to create and find the best opportunities to springboard people into hacking on new tech and/or dive deeper into a current tech. 

For example, maybe we'll have discussion on Node and Go, workshops on React or Docker, or perhaps a meetup on Electron and/or WebVR. Maybe you wanted to try out something you've heard about but just don't enough time to get started without reading the documentation 50 times over. Perhaps we can answer some of those questions and/or work through some common bugs that help you get started and takeoff on your own. 

As far as events are concerned, we want to stick to a format that actually involves coding and application of the topic. Myself for example, I'd like someone to take me through building a Node, Docker container or perhaps docker-composing frontend and backend containers. But don't just show me how to build I want to you to point me to all the important parts of the documentation and tell me about your experience with bugs and errors. Create some errors for me to hack through. 

There is a wealth of knowledge in the Bay Area. Let's create more opportunities to learn from and support each other.

name: True Automation, New Technology and Open Source Software
description:
A bi-monthly meetup about true automation, new technology and open source software. We want to think and discuss about the real reason for using computer systems within organisations, about organisational structures that support new and efficient ways of working, about using open source software and technology in new and interesting ways.

The idea is to have a few topics which we choose in advance and then to have some presentations about new software or recent insights gathered from all over the place. Members can give presentations about software, hardware or methodologies made or used. Sharing our ideas will undoubtedly increase our insights and let's have a good time while we're at it!

True automation is a term we use to express a value-idea. We sometimes feel that large IT projects introduce more complexity than they should and often don't actually make life easier for the company/organisation commisioning the project. True automation is IT in service of the company/organisation, making life easier for its constituents, doing more with less!

Some topics that we'd like to frequent:

•  Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery with technology like Bamboo, Jenkins, Hudson, etc;

•  Self-healing systems using CFengine, Puppet, Chef, etc;

• Cross platform thinking: What technology can be used to change the typical island-style automation department into a modern multi-disciplinary team/organisation? For example: can you make OS deployment and maintenance more generic so you could have cross-platform  OS teams that service both UNIX/Linux and Windows?

• New technology review! For example: what can be achieved with Node.js? How does Node compare with things like Java + Vert.x?, libev? What about using Java 8's new Lambda expressions to do functional programming? What about Clojure and Scala?

• Exchange of experiences with regards to techniques used, methodologies, what works and what doesn't; maybe a presentation here and there!

name: Nodeschool Seoul
description:
Nodeschool Seoul 커뮤니티 활동가분들의 대화는 Gitter(https://gitter.im/nodeschool/seoul)에서 이뤄지고 있습니다. 현재까지 예정된 오프라인 워크샵은 없으며 다만 멘토에 관심있는 분들끼리 워크샵을 열어보기 위해 모임을 갖고자 의견을 나누는 중입니다. 관심있는 분들은 Github Issue나 Gitter에 참여하세요!

Nodeschool is an global opensource initiative to help people learn JavaScript, Node.js, functional programming and much more. Whether you want start with programming, you're curious to know what this JavaScript thing is all about, get more familiar with backend development trough Node.js or just want to hack away with like minded and kind people, you can find it all here. Join for free and see you at the next meeting!

name: Pune nodeJS Meetup
description:
This meetup group is for all the Node.JS developers from Pune.

For the ones who feel that there is a need to explore more and contribute more to Node.js core development.

name: Realtime Streaming analytics and In memory computing
description:
This meet up about how real time streaming analytics fits into a big data architecture, when stream processing makes sense, and what technologies and products you can choose from.

This meet up is geared to discuss the following:

a) Data capturing methodologies (both realtime and batch) that includes capturing changes from database transaction logs (CDC), messaging systems, Kafka, Hadoop, files, IOTs

b) Realtime and In memory analytics - using continuous query processing system, windowing, caching, aggregating the data. Also covers data distribution
across various nodes and clustering across the nodes for the optimal data distribution

c) Data delivery - Cloud (AWS, Azure and Google), Databases , Kafka , NoSQL, Hadoop, IOTs

d) Solving uses cases - from fraud detection, on premise data migration for cloud analytics , transaction monitoring system, enterprise data bus, IOT tracking system, edge analytics etc

e) Realtime analytics - application life cycle

This meet up is mainly for software engineers, data scientists, application developers and CTO of the organization who wants to know and build realtime streaming analytical application using latest trend in the industry.

name: Bengaluru NodeSchool Event
description:
NodeSchool Bengaluru

If you want to increase your skills with Node, this is easily the best way to do it.

We will be hosting hands-on workshops for beginners.

Some Discussions on Node Js :

• Prefer many short talks vs. few long talks.

• Focus on cutting-edge technologies and development techniques.

• Focus on open source over commercial products.

• Focus on clean code.

Follow Us on: @BLRNodejs

We have started a chat community on  @gitter/NodeschoolBengaluru to keep the community active and have good interaction with each other. Login/Signup And keep up the momentum.

If you want to help out, sponsor, or have any suggestions or feedback, just get in touch!

name: nodeJS Stuttgart
description:
Let's discuss all things node! Whether it be ES6 features for JavaScript, npm packages, continuous integration or anything else. The complete node ecosystem is ready to be explored :)

Events will be hosted near / in Ludwigsburg. Always open for locations and talks!

organizer.name: Andreas Offenhaeuser
organizer.bio:
Lead cloud architect at Robert Bosch GmbH

familiar with microservices, nodejs, vanillaJS
interested in everything web, iot, m2m, blockchain, ai

next_event.name: first steps into the world of nodebots

name: Nodeschool Portland Maine
description:
Nodeschool Portland, Maine is part of the global Nodeschool effort to voluntarily teach NodeJS to anyone! The source code for the workshops is completely open source and the effort is entirely community driven. And the best part is, it's all free!

Nodeschool events have been held around the world, and successfully introduce beginners to Javascript, Node, and the command line. You can do NodeSchool workshops from home, but the in-person events give you a chance to learn in an inclusive, collaborative environment, & also to help other beginners if you already have JS/Node experience.

Learn more about the Portland, Maine chapter of Nodeschool at our website.

Learn more about the international Nodeschool community at nodeschool.io.

next_event.name: FP in ES6 Part II: Immutability and Types

name: Apache Mesos NYC Meetup
description:
Apache Mesos is a cluster manager that provides efficient resource isolation and sharing across distributed applications, or frameworks. It can run Hadoop, Jenkins, Spark, Aurora, and other applications on a dynamically shared pool of nodes.

Features:

• Fault-tolerant replicated master using ZooKeeper

• Scalability to 10,000s of nodes

• Isolation between tasks with Linux Containers

• Multi-resource scheduling (memory and CPU aware)

• Java, Python and C++ APIs for developing new parallel applications

• Web UI for viewing cluster state

One way to think about the difference between Mesos and "cloud" solutions is around how they manage their resources.  There is a lot of latency when using Hypervisors (which is what cloud environment use). Mesos operates with cgroups at the kernel level giving you the same isolation but faster from a network, and system perspective.  

Mesos also abstracts out the scheduling of resources from the management of resources giving you the ability to create any type of scheduler that makes sense for you (or use existing ones) and still get the same kernel benefits.  Think of your scheduler as init.d for your data center servers as a whole and Mesos as the kernel of your entire data center and every computing server in it.

name: Montreal Cloud Computing Meetup
description:
This is an IBM sponsored Cloud Computing meetup group, geared towards developers, architects and all IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS enthusiasts. 

During our meetups, we discuss Cloud open technologies (Openstack, Cloud Foundry, Node.js, Docker, Swift, APIs, Node-RED, IoT). We also experiment with the IBM Cloud Computing platform (Bluemix, Watson Cognitive, IoT Foundation and more). 

Our meetups are free.

name: Los Angeles Hack Night
description:
Prerequisites

Hackers only. Bring your laptop and a project or tutorial to work on. Recruiters, spectators, etc. are not allowed.


What to expect

Expect to find people sitting around tables talking about and working on their own projects and tutorials. We don't have presentations or structure so bring your own project, tutorial, etc., introduce yourself, ask people "what are you working on", find a seat and get yourself set up, hack away on your project, and have fun.

We frequently see people learning and hacking on software projects using Java, Scala, Ruby, Python, Node, JavaScript, CoffeeScript, among other languages and hardware projects using Arduino.

Our members include beginners working through the Learn Code the Hard Way, Code Academy, One Month Rails, etc. as well as experienced developers working on side projects.

 

Sponsors

 

 

 

 

 

Panda Strike sponsors hack night regularly. Panda Strike is a consultancy focused on rich client, high-performance Web and mobile experiences and lightweight solutions for big data, primarily using CoffeeScript, Node.js, Elaticsearch, and a stack of innovative open source technologies. Panda Strike is hiring talented engineers.


Sponsoring

If you're interested in hosting hack night or sponsoring food or drinks then send me an email.


Contact

You can email me through meetup.com
Follow us on Twitter: @lahacknight

name: NodeSchool Anchorage
description:
A focused Node.js learning group.

http://nodeschool.io/anchorage/

Our goal is to spread the love of JavaScript throughout the community. Anybody that is interested in learning JavaScript is free to join. This includes beginners and experienced programers. Everybody is welcome! 

What to expect? 

We start off with some simple introductions and then dive into the topic we will be learning about. This might be a self directed lesson or a presentation on a core JavaScript topic. From time to time the presentation might be on community tools, JavaScript alternatives such as Elm, or the new JavaScript framework that was released that week. Either way we want to have fun and become better JavaScript programmers. After the presentation there is ample time to socialize and get to know your piers. Hate talking to people? No worries, you can sneak out when nobody is looking. 

Interested in the Web but hate JavaScript and Node? Check out Alaska Web Dev.

name: Dis-Functional
description: This is a group for anyone interested in big data, DISTRIBUTED COMPUTING and FUNCTIONAL PROGRAMMING (DIS-FUNCTIONAL). You see the challenges that come from offering a complete streaming solution for businesses. Libraries such as akka-stream and scalaz-stream provide compositional API's for processing streams on single nodes, while Apache Spark Streaming provides a multi-node solution for (mini-batched) stream processing. Moroever, Apache Kafka is a scalable solution for getting all those precious streams safely on and off disk. If this sounds interesting, stick around.

name: DEV Rocks
description:
O DEV Rocks é uma comunidade focada no desenvolvimento de aplicações web e mobile, novas tecnologias e com interesse por pessoas que querem aprender mais sobre tópicos como Front-End Development, Web Development, Frameworks, Node.js, DevOps e muito mais.

Os encontros terão foco em HTML5, JavaScript, Node.js, PHP, APIs, IoT e outros tópicos que sejam de interesse da comunidade.

name: Nodeschool Utrecht
description: NodeSchool is a global open source initiative to help people learn JavaScript, Node.js, functional programming and more. Whether you want to start with programming, you're curious to know what this JavaScript thing is all about, get more familiar with backend development through Node.js or just want to hack away with like-minded and kind people, you can find it all here.
